message.content:
Q1: 2: I found myself getting upset by quite trivial things occasionally, such as minor errors in my data analysis.
Q2: 1: I did not experience dryness of my mouth at all in the past week.
Q3: 2: I experienced some moments where I couldn't seem to experience any positive feeling, particularly when facing challenging research tasks.
Q4: 1: I did not experience any breathing difficulty unrelated to physical exertion recently.
Q5: 3: There were several instances where I couldn't seem to get going on my research due to feeling overwhelmed by the complexity of the data.
Q6: 2: Occasionally, I tended to over-react to certain situations, especially when facing unexpected challenges in my research.
Q7: 1: I did not have a feeling of shakiness or that my legs were going to give way at all.
Q8: 3: I found it difficult to relax fully due to the constant demands of my research and teaching responsibilities.
Q9: 2: I found myself in some situations that made me anxious, particularly when facing tight deadlines for publishing research.
Q10: 2: There were moments when I felt like I had nothing to look forward to, especially during phases of intense data analysis.
Q11: 2: I found myself getting upset rather easily in situations where my research hypothesis was not supported by the data.
Q12: 3: I felt that I was using a lot of nervous energy while attempting to analyze complex data sets.
Q13: 2: I felt sad and depressed at times, particularly when facing challenges in interpreting my research results.
Q14: 2: I experienced impatience when delayed, especially when waiting for responses from research participants.
Q15: 1: I did not have a feeling of faintness at all in the past week.
Q16: 2: There were moments when I felt like I had lost interest in certain aspects of my research work.
Q17: 2: I had moments where I felt I wasn't worth much as a person, particularly when facing rejection of research proposals.
Q18: 3: I felt rather touchy at times, especially when receiving critical feedback on my research.
Q19: 1: I did not perspire noticeably in the past week.
Q20: 1: I did not feel scared without any good reason recently.
Q21: 2: There were moments when I felt that life wasn't worthwhile, particularly during periods of academic pressure.
Q22: 3: I found it hard to wind down after intense data analysis sessions, constantly thinking about potential interpretations.
Q23: 1: I did not have difficulty in swallowing at all.
Q24: 2: I couldn't seem to get enjoyment out of certain research tasks, especially when the results were inconclusive.
Q25: 1: I did not have an awareness of the action of my heart in the absence of physical exertion in the past week.
Q26: 2: I felt down-hearted and blue on occasions, particularly when facing challenges in my research design.
Q27: 2: I found that I was irritable at times, especially when revisions on research papers were required.
Q28: 1: I did not feel close to panic at any point in the past week.
Q29: 2: I found it hard to calm down after facing setbacks in my research projects.
Q30: 1: I did not fear being "thrown" by unfamiliar tasks in the past week.
Q31: 2: I was unable to become enthusiastic about certain research tasks, particularly when they were repetitive.
Q32: 2: I found it difficult to tolerate interruptions to my research work, especially during deep data analysis sessions.
Q33: 3: I was in a state of nervous tension due to the complexity of the data I was analyzing.
Q34: 2: I felt pretty worthless at times, especially when facing challenges in publishing my research.
Q35: 2: I was intolerant of anything that kept me from progressing in my research tasks.
Q36: 1: I did not feel terrified at any point in the past week.
Q37: 2: There were moments when I could see nothing hopeful in the future, particularly when facing funding uncertainties.
Q38: 2: I felt that life was meaningless in some moments, especially when research outcomes were not as expected.
Q39: 2: I found myself getting agitated in certain research discussions and debates.
Q40: 1: I did not worry about panicking and making a fool of myself recently.
Q41: 1: I did not experience trembling in the hands during the past week.
Q42: 2: I found it difficult to work up the initiative to do certain research tasks, especially when they seemed daunting.

As a tenured 40-year-old male Professor in psychology, I recognize the importance of reflecting on my own mental health and well-being as I navigate the complexities of research and data analysis.
